classData.comment:
/**
 * The DomEvent Manager is responsible for distributing DOM events to the matching components.
 * It supports event delegation and "Logical Component Bubbling", allowing events to bubble up
 * the logical component hierarchy (e.g. `component.parent`) even if the DOM hierarchy is
 * disconnected (e.g. Portals, DragProxies, Multi-Window setups).
 *
 * @class Neo.manager.DomEvent
 * @extends Neo.core.Base
 * @singleton
 */
classData.description: The DomEvent Manager is responsible for distributing DOM events to the matching components. It supports event delegation and "Logical Component Bubbling", allowing events to bubble up the logical component hierarchy (e.g. component.parent) even if the DOM hierarchy is disconnected (e.g. Portals, DragProxies, Multi-Window setups).
classData.name: DomEvent

classData.comment:
/**
     * Iterates the event path to find matching listeners on components.
     * It utilizes `ComponentManager.getParentPath()` to construct a logical component path,
     * ensuring events bubble to logical ancestors (like a Dashboard owning a DragProxy)
     * even if they are not physical ancestors in the DOM.
     *
     * @param {Object} event
     * @protected
     */
classData.description: Iterates the event path to find matching listeners on components. It utilizes ComponentManager.getParentPath() to construct a logical component path, ensuring events bubble to logical ancestors (like a Dashboard owning a DragProxy) even if they are not physical ancestors in the DOM.
classData.name: fire

classData.comment:

classData.description: Mounts local domEvent listeners for a given component
classData.name: mountDomListeners

classData.comment:

     * @param {String}  config.vnodeId

     */

returns.description: true if the listener got registered successfully (false in case it was already there)

classData.name: register

returns.description: true in case the listener did exist and got removed

classData.name: unregister

classData.comment:
/**
     * Verifies if the event target (or a delegate matching node) is a descendant of the listener's component.
     * This check supports two modes:
     * 1. **DOM Ancestry (Standard):** Checks if the target is physically inside the listener's DOM node.
     * 2. **Logical Ancestry (Fallback):** If the DOM check fails, it checks the `componentPath` to see if the
     *    target belongs to a component that is logically a descendant of the listener component.
     *    This is crucial for handling events from detached components (Portals/Proxies).
     *
     * @param {Object} listener
     * @param {Array} path            The raw DOM path from the event
     * @param {Array} [componentPath] The logical component ID path
     * @returns {Boolean|String} true/targetId in case the delegation string matches the event path
     */
classData.description:
Verifies if the event target (or a delegate matching node) is a descendant of the listener's component. This check supports two modes:

  1. DOM Ancestry (Standard): Checks if the target is physically inside the listener's DOM node.
  2. Logical Ancestry (Fallback): If the DOM check fails, it checks the componentPath to see if the target belongs to a component that is logically a descendant of the listener component. This is crucial for handling events from detached components (Portals/Proxies).

params.description: The raw DOM path from the event
params.name: path

returns.description: true/targetId in case the delegation string matches the event path

classData.name: verifyDelegationPath
